value: Parque de Santo Domingo, with Iglesia Porta Coeli at the far left

. It's best known for its Spanish colonial architecture.
From San Juan, follow Autopista 52 (Expreso Luis A. Ferre) towards Ponce.  At the PR-52 terminus, follow PR-2 for about 25 miles towards Mayaguez.  Exit at the PR-122 / Casto Perez Ave. exit on PR-2.
There are limited transit options, but the central district is easily navigable on foot. Driving is difficult with lots of traffic in mid-day.
San Germán's main sight is its
, all narrow, twisty alleyways and Spanish buildings in pastel colors, some crumbling, some newly repaired.  The old city is centered around the leafy plazas of

value: content=Dating back to 1606, this is one of the oldest churches in the Americas.  It now hosts a museum of religious paintings.

content=A Spanish baroque church straddling the two plazas.  Even older in theory (a chapel was first built here in 1573), but the present structure dates mostly to 1737, when it was rebuilt after an earthquake.
content=Professional basketball team with the most history and championships in the Pro basketball league in Puerto Rico (BSN). League runs usually from April thru July.
content=One of the oldest pharmacies . About 80 year old pharmacy. At Parque de Santo Domingo

San German is the gastronomic center of the area. Throughout the years, several restaurants have served both locals and visitors. Two restaurants, institutions in the town, are Mike's Steak House, with its famous churrasco, and Palermo Pizzeria & Italian Restaurant. Both have been open for more than 30 years.

value: directions=1 block behind Porta Coeli Museum
content=Located in the newly restored  Acosta Fores home, built in 1912. Puertorrican revival cuisine served in the elegant Danza room or al fresco in the Bomba bistro

directions=From Carr#2, Ave. Casto Perez will take you less than 1 mile to your left, in the Las Lomas Shopping Ctre.

content=Mike's Steak House is a gastronomical institution. Known in San German and throughout the island for its "Churrasco al Carbon", it also offers other USDA Choice Steaks, Mofongo rellenos as well as Chicken, fish and shrimp dishes.

Late 2008, we remodeled the restaurant, now offering a private pub-cafe type bar, spearated from the main lounge area.

Our prices continue to be very moderate! Buen provecho!

Hotel Oasis , Quaint Bed & Breakfast located in the heart of town. #72 Luna Street.
If you've made it this far, don't miss the beaches of the southern coast.
